#SRBdebates2021 word cloud from our followers today. Which topics would you like to hear more in our events?

https://t.co/juBJcjGmUJ https://t.co/SgdNfOIFl8

(2/2) ... "We are at the core of the debate of the free flow of capital liquidity. Much easier said than done, particularly across jurisdictions" 
- Sebastiano Laviola, @EU_SRB Board Member at the #SRBdebates2021
(1/2) "It is important in the home-host debate to have a sufficient amount of resources ready to deploy in the various part of the world [...]" https://t.co/bO0eErYjGV

"We must be very practical: make sure that within our framework, we have resources in the event of a need to transfer losses from the host or to give the host local entities support in the event of a parental crisis" David Livingstone CEO EMEA @Citi #SRBdebates2021 https://t.co/tC2Ab2nPt2

"We need mutual trust in supervisory approaches and to build this trust in day-to-day supervision and information sharing and resolution planning" 
@TobiasTroeger, Director for the Cluster of Law & Finance, @SAFE_Frankfurt at the #SRBdebates2021 #homehost issues https://t.co/00NJFOttuw

"Cross-border risks need to be managed by a combination of internationally agreed standards, close international cooperation, supervision and resolution regulation, and a shared assessment of global systemic risks" Sasha Mills, @bankofengland at #SRBdebates2021 https://t.co/YoZYiJ2Z9G

"Ensuring an SPE strategy is fully operationalised is a key priority for all resolution authorities and it will help us overcome the home-host friction that might fragment the market and would be detrimental to financial stability" #SRB Chair Elke König at the #SRBdebates2021 https://t.co/TzZt8R8EfV
